medical_history.chief_complaint: Sharp right lower quadrant (RLQ) pain radiating to the back, nausea, and anorexia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient first noted sharp suprapubic pains 2 days ago, which were intermittent and radiated to the back, not responding to ibuprofen. Early this morning, she was awoken by persistent pain localized to the RLQ, which no longer radiated. Since symptom onset, she has experienced anorexia and nausea, along with an episode of diarrhea this morning. Walking exacerbates the pain. Urinary frequency began approximately 1 month ago.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Asthma; Chronic neck and lower back pain (status post steroid injection in cervical spine); Chronic headaches (status post multiple occipital nerve blocks).
